title: Tim Griesenbeck
text: Carlos Phillipe "Tim" Griesenbeck (December 10, 1897 – March 25, 1953) was a <a href="Major%20League%20Baseball">Major League Baseball</a> <a href="catcher">catcher</a> who played for the <a href="St.%20Louis%20Cardinals">St. Louis Cardinals</a> in . Griesenbeck attended the Agricultural and Mechanical College of Texas—now known as <a href="Texas%20A%26amp%3BM%20University">Texas A&M University</a>, where he lettered in baseball and <a href="American%20football">football</a>. He served as the head football coach at <a href="St.%20Mary%27s%20University%2C%20Texas">St. Mary's University</a>, located in <a href="San%20Antonio">San Antonio, Texas</a>, for one season, in 1927.
